definition: to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: You should take some aspirins to allay your fever.
sentences.chinese: 你需要退热，你应该吃些阿司匹林。

sentences.english: This antipyretic action is usually rapid and effective in febrile patients .
sentences.chinese: 对发热病人，这种退热作用通常迅速有效。

sentences.english: Alcohol use with acetaminophen is especially bad for the liver.
sentences.chinese: 含有退热净的酒尤其会很伤肝脏。

sentences.english: Cooling paste based on polyacrylate hydrogel was fabricated via radical polymerization.
sentences.chinese: 制备了以聚丙烯酸钠为基材的高分子水凝胶退热贴。

sentences.english: Wouldn't it be easier just to give them acetaminophen?
sentences.chinese: 难道给他们一些退热净不更简单么？

sentences.english: One thing I want to explore is whether acetaminophen can also help reduce these behavioral consequences.
sentences.chinese: 我想探究一件事就是退热净能否减轻这些行为表现。

sentences.english: Then you'd better buy some cooling gel.
sentences.chinese: 那您最好买一些退热贴。

sentences.english: Taking too much Acidemedafon acetaminophen can cause liver damage and even death.
sentences.chinese: 服用过多退热净可能会造成肝损伤甚至死亡。

sentences.english: Side effects of antipyretics , and non-last resort do not.
sentences.chinese: 退热药副作用大，非万不得已不用。

sentences.english: Darling has a fever, besides eat should beyond what idea to still have quickly antifebrile ?
sentences.chinese: 宝宝发烧，除了吃要以外还有什么办法快点退热？

definition: antipyretic (drug to reduce fever, such as sulfanilamide)
Ibuprofen or Nurofen/also called 異丁苯丙酸|异丁苯丙酸

pinyin: dui4 yi3 xian1 an1 ji1 fen1
